R bugs

Source: vignettes/bugRzilla.Rmd
bugRzilla.Rmd
library(bugRzilla)

Introduction

Some time ago the R core team requested help with bugs in bugzilla. Some time later on a thank you post they reported bugs closed over time. Which pointed out that we, users, package developer might not be helping enough. This packages tries to lower the barrier to improve R by finding bugs, testing and checking they are reproducible.

To do so this package is to support ease the interaction with bugzilla for a user who wants to:

  • see what happened/what’s happening.

  • submit/validate/comment on existing issues.

To do so it uses the Bugzilla API1 and sometimes the accessible xml files.

The package

Any updates?

check_last_audit()
#> [1] "2021-02-12 UTC"

Getting data

If you don’t want much information but want’s to know about an issue you have get_issue() :

issue1 <- get_issue(1)
issue1[, 1:5]
#>   attachid commentid comment_count           who            bug_when
#> 2       NA         1             0         admin 2010-02-15 18:29:54
#> 3       NA         2             1         admin 2010-02-15 18:33:25
#> 1        1         3             2         admin 2010-02-16 17:42:59
#> 4       NA     83214             3 simon.urbanek 2010-03-09 18:14:23
#> 5       NA     83218             4         admin 2010-03-10 16:54:39

Authentication

Most queries do not require authentication but some do. To set up an authentication you’ll need a user (You have to ask for an account to bug-report-request@r-project.org), and then create an API key.

create_api_key()

This will ask you to save your API key to .Renviron. To check that the api key is working (after resetting the R session) you have:

check_key()

  1. The full documentation of the API is here.↩︎
